greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Divisor-or-multiple permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A052330(A304083(n)).
comment: Each a(n) is always either a divisor or a multiple of a(n+1).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
program: up_to_e = 16; \\ Good for computing up to n = (2^16)-1
i = 0; for(n=1,oo,if(ispow2(isprimepower(n)), i++; v050376[i] = n); if(i == up_to_e,break));
A304085(n) = A052330(A304083(n)); \\ Needs also code from A304083
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 06 2018
